definition: foreign enterprise/company established in mainland China with direct investment from foreign entities or from investors in Taiwan, Macao or Hong Kong/abbr. for 外資企業|外资企业
to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]

sentences.english: They don’t want to do anything to upset the government.
sentences.chinese: 外企不想做任何使中国政府感到不适的事。

sentences.english: Now I am working at a large-scale international enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 现在大型涉外企业工作。

sentences.english: This in a way highlights the difficulty of foriegn companies doing business in China.
sentences.chinese: 这正说明了外企在中国做生意的艰难。

sentences.english: Only 59% of their foreign competitors said so.
sentences.chinese: 而外企仅有59%愿在网上卖货。

sentences.english: The candidates with multi-national company experiences is preferred.
sentences.chinese: 有外企公司工作经历者优先。

sentences.english: Experience in FIEs and background in Mechanical Engineering will be advantages for this position.
sentences.chinese: 有外企工作经验以及有机械工程类背景者优先。

sentences.english: Since Ai joined the first foreign company, she has changed jobs three times.
sentences.chinese: 小艾自进入外企公司先后变换了三次工作。

sentences.english: In China half the patent filings in 2004 were by foreign companies.
sentences.chinese: 2004年，中国专利申请中的一半，由外企提出。

sentences.english: Others will envy a multi-national company work, it is you want?
sentences.chinese: 别人会羡慕一份外企公司的工作，这是你想要的么？

sentences.english: Therefore, it's urgent to strengthen foreign business information message work.
sentences.chinese: 所以要加强涉外企业的信息情报工作是当务之急。

sentences.english: Dong Haochun from Jiangsu province is an executive in a foreign-owned enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 来自江苏的董浩春是一家外企的总裁。

sentences.english: I remember. I met you when I took an interview of a foreign-own company about a month ago.
sentences.chinese: 我在一家外企应聘时见过你，有一个月了。

sentences.english: But secrets were a particular concern for foreign businesses.
sentences.chinese: 但外企尤其关注的是商业秘密的部分。

sentences.english: Classmate: Do you always want to work in the foreign ventures?
sentences.chinese: 同学:那你想一直在外企工作吗？

sentences.english: Compared with Li's classmates in foreign enterprises, Li's life was rather comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 和在外企的的同学相比，李的生活确实惬意很多。

sentences.english: Relevant administrative experience in MKT or Sales of multinational companies preferred.
sentences.chinese: 有外企销售或市场行政工作经验优先。

definition: private enterprise/abbr. of 私營企業|私营企业[si1 ying2 qi3 ye4]
state enterprise/(Tw) abbr. for 國際企業管理|国际企业管理, international business management (as a subject of study)
abbr. for 外商獨資企業|外商独资企业[wai4 shang1 du2 zi1 qi3 ye4]
student graduating in the current year/recent graduate
government (viewed as an organization)/institutions of government/government office
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
centrally-managed state-owned enterprise (PRC), abbr. for 中央企業|中央企业[zhong1 yang1 qi3 ye4]
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
